Geesthacht: New bedding signs to encourage replanting
Franko Stein (FD Umwelt, left) and Friedhelm Ringe (Nabu)
set up the plant signs in the beds of the pedestrian zone.
The "Geesthacht blooms" campaign also includes information about what is currently blooming there currently in the colours white and pink.
Geesthacht.
"Geesthacht blooms" is the name of a campaign by Nabu in cooperation with the city administration.
With the participation of many volunteers from associations, schools, daycare centers, companies and institutions, thousands of flower bulbs and plants have been planted since 2015.
Goal: In the Geesthacht urban area, flowering hins are to be created over a wide area, on which insects can find food at any time.
"If the weather is favourable, the bees fly out as early as January to look for food," says Friedhelm Ringe from Geesthacht Nabu.
He himself has beehives on the property.

To ensure that the undertaking does not only remain an action by conservationists and the city's environmental service, but also draws wide circles into the private gardens, explanatory boards are repeatedly placed on the plants.
There are about 50 signs so far.
In this way, passers-by should be able to find out what is blooming here so beautifully.
The hope is that amateur gardeners will replant at home in a targeted manner.
In the first week of January, the wild hazel season started
More recently, shrubs such as winter honeysuckle and winter viburnum are in the beds of the pedestrian zone.
They have been stuck in the soil of the tubs on Bergedorer Straße for a year now, showing the first delicate flowers in white and pink without leaves and have recently been given further signs.
"The winter honeysuckle is a very broad-bushy shrub and can grow between two meters high and three meters wide," it reads under further information, for example on the suitable location.
Friedhelm Ringe emphasizes that it is not only the bedding plants that are now showing flowers.
In the first week of January, the wild hazel season started.
It blooms particularly profusely on the Richtweg near the incline, in Gutenbergstraße, Wilhelm-Holert-Straße, Fahrendofer Weg and many bends.
Ernestine is 102 years old:
"Stepping keeps me young"
Munich Dance god Fred Astaire would certainly be proud of them when he looks down from the sky at Munich's Ostbahnhof!
Every Monday, three ladies meet there in the "Mandolin Motion Show Academy" at 3 p. m.
Sharp for a brisk tap dance together they are an incredible 277 years old, pardon young!
The oldest of them is Ernestine Stauchner, who recently celebrated her 102nd birthday.
For the Munich native (January 15, 1921) from the Schwanthaler Höh", Monday is THE highlight of the week.
"Dancing and tapping is my life, I can't imagine without it".
Eva-Maria Stolze (almost 97) and Elfriede Widmann (79) are also dancing with Ernestine.
The 97-year-old was born in Jena (Thuringia) in 1926.
She was a soubrette, today you would say a musical performer, worked together with the legendary Marika Rökk.
"I've spent my life dancing, acting and singing.
At the age of 79, Elfriede Widmann is something of a chick in the group of tap dancers.
She says: "We just have fun here with our dance teacher Sissy Engl".
Wikipedia:
Tap dance was developed in the USA in the 19th century and is now known all over the world.

With two metal plates, each of which are more durable than the wooden soles initially used, attached to the front and back of the shoes, rhythmic sounds are produced while dancing that match the visual impression and the music.
The dancer thus also becomes a percussion musician.
The English expression for this is onomatopoeic tap dance and the French Claquettes.
Spanish flamenco may have influenced tap dancing.
The tips of the shoes are nailed so that they produce a clearly audible sound when dancing.
The 77-year-old Sissi Engl is the good soul of the dance studio at Ostbahnhof.
She is an actress, dancer and choreographer.
"We are a big family, big and small, old and young are welcome".
And what is the recipe for such a long life?
"The movement keeps me young," the 102-year-old told BILD.
Her advice to everyone: "Exercise, healthy food and no alcohol".
Analogue in Dialogue
The Limits of the Digital
As digitization progresses, the desire for analogue is growing again for some

The speed with which our everyday lives became digital left us little time to set up rules for dealing with them and to adapt our communication and working methods to them, says DNN columnist Claudia Muntschick.
Dresden.
If you wanted to make a telephone call in Bautzen in 1985, there were three options.
Either you were one of the six percent of the lucky ones who had a private connection.
Or you were one of those who had someone from this exclusive group in the neighborhood and could call your relatives for a bottle of Radeberger.
Or you could go to a telephone booth.
The smell of the plastic headphones and the click of the coins in the vending machine are unforgettable.
My biggest dream was to be able to see the other person's face when calling video telephony, I thought, what a great thing that would be!
What's next in Moldova?
14 days for a new government
In Moldova (also: Moldova), President Maia Sandu has tasked former Interior Minister Dorin Recean with forming a government.
The 48-year-old economic expert now has 14 days to do so.
So far, Recean has been one of the president's advisers.
After only a year and a half in office, Prime Minister Natalia Gavrilita surprisingly resigned.
The pro-European head of government was under massive pressure, as she herself announced as an explanation for her resignation apparently she was hostile to pro-Russian forces.
The president thanked
Gavrilita for her "enormous sacrifices".
Moldova is a neighboring country of Ukraine and is suffering from the economic consequences of the war.
Inflation is over 40 percent and the small republic has taken in tens of thousands of refugees from Ukraine.
In the parliament in Chisinau, the pro-European party PAS (Party of Action and Solidarity), founded by President Sandu, has a comfortable majority, occupying 63 out of 101 seats.
The confirmation of the new head of government and his cabinet should therefore not be a problem.
However, pro-European politicians have lost popularity in Moldova in recent months, while pro-Russian politicians with support from the Kremlin have become more popular.

Bö continued his impressive streak despite difficult conditions and also won the sixth sprint race of the season.
The five-time Olympic champion has now collected 14 world championship titles and continues to catch up with his compatriot Ole Einar Björndalen.
The biathlon icon, who is on site as a TV pundit, is still the undisputed record champion with 20 World Championship gold medals.
Even heavy fog did not prevent perennial winner Bö from collecting his second gold on the Rennsteig.

Hardly anyone doubts that number three will follow in the chase race.

Meanwhile, nothing came together at Doll again.
After the veteran had missed all chances of a medal at the start with a penalty lap in the mixed relay and there had only been sixth place, things didn't go any better three days later.

Three penalty rounds already in prone shooting and two more standing were a big disappointment for the oldest member of the German team, who had celebrated the greatest success of his career in this discipline in 2017.
Six years ago, he surprisingly won in Hochfilzen by a razor-thin margin of 0. 7 seconds ahead of Bö.
It was one of only three career successes for Doll, who has been on the podium once so far this winter.

Biden receives
Lula: "We must stand up for democracy"
A meeting between US President Joe Biden and his Brazilian counterpart, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, will focus on the value of democracy.
Both look back on their predecessors.
US President Joe Biden insisted on the preservation of democratic values during a visit by his Brazilian counterpart Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.
"The strong democracy of our two nations has been put to the test," Biden said Friday at the White House in Washington.
"We must continue to stand up for democracy, for the democratic values that are at the core of our strength.
Lula replied with regard to his right-wing predecessor Jair Bolsonaro: "Brazil has isolated itself for four years".
The left-wing politician Lula had prevailed against Bolsonaro in a run-off election at the end of October.
Lula took office on January 1.
The change of power was accompanied by serious riots.
Bolsonaro's supporters had stormed Congress, the Supreme Court and the seat of government in the capital Brasília in January.

The outbreak of violence in Brazil is a grim reminder of the storming of the U. S. Capitol a good two years ago, in which supporters of then-President Donald Trump forcibly invaded parliament in Washington.
Lula openly criticized Bolsonaro at the meeting with Biden.
His predecessor did not pay much attention to international relations.
"His world began and ended with fake news, morning, afternoon and night," Lula said.
"Sounds familiar," Biden replied an obvious reference to his predecessor Trump.

Deutsche Bank CEO Christian Sewing considers further interest rate hikes to be "absolutely" necessary in the fight against the high inflation rate.
"Inflationary risks remain high.
The cost of energy can rise again slightly, and China's opening up can also give prices a temporary boost," Sewing told Welt am Sonntag.

At the beginning of February, the European Central Bank (ECB) raised interest rates in the euro area for the fifth time in a row and held out the prospect of a further increase of 0. 5 percentage points for the meeting on 16 March.
The key interest rate in the euro area is now 3. 0 percent.
The deposit rate that commercial banks receive when they park money at the ECB is 2. 5 percent.
Higher interest rates make loans more expensive.
This can slow down demand and thus counteract high inflation rates.
At the same time, higher lending rates can lead to investments being postponed and thus weaker economic growth.
Rising interest rates are also a burden for highly indebted euro countries such as Italy.
"The consequences of persistently high inflation are much more severe than the higher financing costs for some countries," Sewing said.
"Of course, we have to keep an eye on this, but a high level of debt must not prevent the ECB from acting consistently.
The ECB is aiming for price stability in the euro area in the medium term with an inflation rate of two percent.
This target has been a long way off for months.
Although the upward trend in prices weakened again in January, consumer prices in the currency area of the now 20 countries were still 8.
5 percent higher than in the same month last year.
Higher inflation rates reduce the purchasing power of consumers, because they can then afford less for one euro.
Sharply increased energy prices, which are a major driver of inflation, are also a burden for companies.
If inflation remains high, private consumption will "collapse sooner or later," warned Sewing, who is also president of the Association of German Banks (BdB).
"I currently see this as the greatest threat to the German economy.
But I am optimistic that we can avoid this scenario.
Bosch CEO
Stefan
Hartung hopes for a broad debate on Chancellor Olaf Scholz's (SPD) proclamation of the "German pace" in infrastructure projects.
"There will have to be a political and social dialogue on this.
And it may also be a bit more controversial," he told the German Press Agency in Stuttgart.

He hopes that in the end a set of rules will emerge that does not necessarily have to go as fast as with the LNG terminals that went into operation at the turn of the year but also not as slowly as before.
In mid-December, after ten months of planning and construction, the first German terminal for the import of liquefied natural gas (LNG) was opened.
The aim was to close the gap in gas supply due to the lack of Russian gas supplies.
German Chancellor Olaf Scholz (SPD) spoke of a new "Germany pace" on the occasion.
In addition, the German government had recently initiated an acceleration of approval procedures for wind turbines and power lines.
"First of all, it's very reassuring that the government acts so quickly when it matters.
However, this should not automatically mean that from now on we will always act so categorically and, for example, put a wind turbine in the neighbor's garden against his will," said Hartung.
Therefore, there must still be a process of negotiation as to what is right and wrong as a society.
In the past, they tried the classic set of rules and did not succeed.
"We should think again about whether the previous approach was the right one.
Maybe we overdid it with the rules and made it too complicated for us.
In view of the many open tasks, such as the expansion of the power lines, he does not envy the federal government and the companies involved, said Hartung.
"As a consumer of these energies, I absolutely need the expansion and it should be as green as possible.
Union warns of break-up of Bayer Group
The chemical trade union IG BCE warns of a break-up of the company after an announced change of boss at Bayer.

"From the employees' point of view, Bayer, with its three pillars, is exactly right for the challenges of the future," Francesco Grioli, member of the union's Board of Management and Bayer Supervisory Board, told the Rheinische Post (Saturday edition).
This refers to the pharmaceutical business with prescription medicines, the Consumer Health business with over-the-counter medicines and the agricultural business.
"The transformation of the industry can only be managed with a corporate policy based on risk diversification and sustainability and not on hedge fund activism.
The background to this is the change of management at the pharmaceutical and agrochemical group announced on Thursday.
The controversial boss Werner Baumann will vacate the post this summer.
At the beginning of June, the ex-head of pharmaceuticals of Swiss rival Roche, Bill Anderson, is to take over.
Baumann has been criticized for a long time.
The acquisition of the US seed manufacturer Monsanto, completed in 2018 for 63 billion dollars, hangs on the manager.
With the purchase, the Leverkusen-based company had brought expensive legal disputes over alleged cancer risks of the weed killer glyphosate into the house.
Bayer's stock has been in decline for years.
In 2019, shareholders even refused to ratify the actions of the CEO at the Annual General Meeting.
It has been known for some time that Baumann is not seeking an extension of his contract, which was supposed to run until 2024.
Pressure had been exerted by long-term strategic investors.
Most recently, several activist Anglo-Saxon investors such as Bluebell Capital have also got involved.
According to a media report, Bluebell is pushing for a split of the group.
The very small fund with an unknown stake in Bayer is known for its aggressive approach.
A spin-off "of the Consumer Health division would be a possible way to increase the value of the company," said Markus Manns, fund manager at Union Investment, the "Rheinische Post".
On the other hand, he does not consider a spin-off of the much larger agricultural division Crop Science to be feasible.
Hundreds of thousands want to demonstrate against pension reform
Paris
On Saturday, the French want to take to the streets again against the planned pension reform.
The trade unions are opposing a government project with the concentrated protest on the streets.
Hundreds of thousands want to demonstrate again on Saturday against the pension reform.
In France, hundreds of thousands of people are expected to demonstrate against President Emmanuel Macron's planned pension reform on Saturday.
For the fourth time, the trade unions are mobilising against the centre-right government's plans to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64.
Twice already, more than a million people took to the streets and there were nationwide strikes.
Last Tuesday, 750,000 participants in protests were counted.
A turbulent debate in parliament has been going on for a week about the controversial reform.
Many people in France are already working longer than the age of 62 if they have not paid in long enough for a deduction-free pension by the time they reach retirement age.
In many strenuous professions, people could hardly work longer, say the opponents of the reform.
In addition, the employees wanted to be able to enjoy their well-deserved retirement and not completely wear out their health at work.
Macron: Imminent deficit in pension fund
Macron justifies the reform with an imminent deficit in the pension fund.
Because the population is getting older and older, employees would have to pay for an increasing number of pensioners with their contributions.
In order for the amount of the pension to be kept stable, the population would have to work a little more.
Critics cast doubt on the government's calculations and demand that the state find other sources of money to keep the pension system in balance.
But the government does not only want to work on the retirement age.
The increase in the required payment period for a full pension, which was decided years ago, is to be accelerated.
In addition, individual pension schemes with privileges for certain occupational groups are to be abolished.
The minimum pension is to rise to about 1200 euros.
The pension reform is considered one of President Macron's most important projects.
During the Corona pandemic, a first attempt to implement the reform was abandoned, and even then there were massive protests and strikes.
Several presidents before
Macron had already tried to reform the French pension system with varying degrees of success widespread protest and strikes were certain for all.
Since Macron's camp no longer has an absolute majority in parliament, it hopes to push through the reform with the help of the conservative Républicains, which have announced support.
But some of the MEPs even from Macron's group still have reservations.
And even greater than the fear of a close vote is likely to be Macron's concern about paralyzing strikes at the moment.

Before the renewed demonstrations on Saturday, the president said that he could count on the sense of responsibility of the organizers so that they proceeded calmly and did not lead to a blockade of the country.
Calm weather expected lots of sun at high altitudes
A powerful high-pressure area lies over Central Europe and determines the weather in Germany.
Does this mean that a lot of sunshine can be expected everywhere?
Offenbach
In Germany, calm high-pressure weather is expected at least until the middle of the week.

"When looking at the weather maps, a powerful high-pressure area directly over Central Europe immediately catches the eye," explains meteorologist Markus Übel from the German Weather Service on Saturday in Offenbach.
"Admittedly, this high will shift a little to the east over the next week.
However, it continues to determine the weather in Germany.
However, calm high-pressure weather in winter does not necessarily mean sunny weather, says Übel.
"Such a high can even be quite mean and give the people in the lowlands dreary high fog gray for days, while in the high altitudes of the low mountain ranges there is pure sun".
Sunday starts foggy and cloudy in most regions.
From the Ore Mountains and the Thuringian Forest to Lower Bavaria, it can still rain a little, according to the DWD.
Especially on the edge of the Alps, but also in the southwest and partly in the west, the cloud cover loosens up during the day and the sun appears more and more frequently.
In the rest of the country, it remains very cloudy or overcast with high fog.
Temperatures reach 4 to 9 degrees, near the Rhine around 10 degrees.
"On Monday, the sun, which is gradually getting stronger, nibbles on the high fog again and can dissolve it more and more during the day," says the meteorologist.

On the edge of the Alps, in the high altitudes of the low mountain ranges and in parts of North Rhine-Westphalia, sun is expected all day, elsewhere it has to fight its way through the high fog cover.
The maximum temperatures are 5 to 9 degrees, on the Lower Rhine around 11 degrees, in the permanent gray in the southeast, on the other hand, only around 3 degrees are expected.
In addition, weak winds blow from different directions.
On Tuesday there may again be only tough dissipation of fog or high fog in some lowlands.
Otherwise, the weather will be cheerful after the fog has cleared.
At high altitudes, in large parts of North Rhine-Westphalia and on the edge of the Alps, the sun is expected to shine all day.
Temperatures climb to 5 to 11 degrees, depending on the sunshine.

The defeated top favorite Sofia Goggia was severely disappointed after her exit in the downhill of the Alpine World Ski Championships.
Méribel
"I'm sad because I didn't perform as well as I can," the Italian said on ZDF after she had threaded a goal and was eliminated.

Goggia has been the dominant downhill skier in the World Cup for years.
She has won four of the six races in this discipline so far this season.
After winning gold in Pyeongchang in 2018, she won silver at the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing.
However, Goggia, who is known for her risky driving style, still has to wait for a World Championship medal in her parade discipline.
She was absent from her home race in Cortina d'Ampezzo two years ago due to injury.
"I actually thought I was in a good mood.
It was a matter of hundredths of a second," said Goggia after Switzerland's Jasmine Flury's surprising victory in Méribel, France.
"I'm disappointed.
I gave it my all.
But that's life.
Sometimes you think things are guaranteed, she said of the medal expected and ultimately missed by all experts: "But they are not".

Zelensky and ministers against
Russia's participation in the Olympics
Kiev.

With the demand for the exclusion of Russian and Belarusian athletes from the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris, sports politicians from 35 nations have increased the pressure on the International Olympic Committee (IOC).

At a joint conference call, it was agreed to write a statement to prevent attempts to send athletes from Russia and Belarus back to international sports competitions, the Lithuanian Ministry of Sports announced on its website.

"We call for the exclusion of Russian and Belarusian athletes from all international competitions, including the Olympic Games, as long as the war in Ukraine continues," said Minister Jurgita Šiugždinienė.
The video consultation took place on the initiative of Great Britain.
It was a very productive meeting, wrote British Sports Minister Lucy Frazer on Twitter.
"And I made Britain's position very clear: as long as Putin continues his barbaric war, Russia and Belarus will not be allowed to be represented at the Olympics.
We will now issue a joint statement on this issue.

Earlier, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky protested against the participation of athletes from Russia and Belarus in international competitions at an international video conference of sports ministers and other high-ranking representatives.
"While Russia kills and terrorizes, representatives of this terrorist state have no place in sports and Olympic competitions," Zelensky said.
He published his speech on his Telegram channel.
Because of the Russian war of aggression, a neutral flag is ultimately soaked in blood and unbearable.
Ukraine threatens to boycott
Ukraine also sees Belarus as a party to the war because the country provides Russian troops with military bases for attacks.
Zelensky called on officials to stand up for the protection of Olympic principles and prevent Russian athletes from being admitted to the competitions.
The president also renewed his criticism of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), which has "unfortunately lost its honesty".
The occasion for the conference was the IOC's announcement that it would allow athletes from Russia and Belarus to participate in international competitions under certain conditions.
Ukraine is also threatening a boycott if the IOC allows the athletes.
The Federal Ministry of the Interior also takes a stand

The Federal Ministry of the Interior, which is responsible for sports, subsequently stated that it had also reaffirmed during the consultations that it would reject the participation of Russian and Belarusian athletes in Paris.
"From our point of view, there is no reason to invite Russian and Belarusian sports to return to competitions.
The Ukrainian athletes must continue to enjoy the full solidarity and support of the international sports community.
The IOC's efforts to resume the Russian and Belarusian athletes are the wrong way to go," a spokesman for the Ministry of the Interior said in response to a dpa request.

Interior Minister Nancy Faeser (SPD) had already emphasized at the end of January: "Sport should be clear in its condemnation of the brutal war that Putin is waging against the Ukrainian civilian population.
Major sporting events don't happen in a vacuum.
Russia, on the other hand, emphasizes that sport and politics must be separated.
Currently, Russia and Belarus are excluded from many international sports competitions.

However, the IOC is seeking a return of athletes from both countries to the international sports stage under a neutral flag, provided that they are clearly committed to the Olympic Charter and do not actively support the war in Ukraine.
IOC President Thomas Bach had recently declared that an exclusion "because of a passport or place of birth" violates the prohibition of discrimination.

Second-to-last Prime Minister of the GDR, Hans Modrow, died
Hans Modrow is dead, as the Left faction in the Bundestag announced.
The 95-year-old died on Saturday night.
Bundestag group chairman Dietmar Bartsch paid tribute to the former SED functionary and later PDS and Left Party politician as a "deeply sincere socialist.
Last night, "Hans Modrow left us at the age of 95," the Left Party faction in the Bundestag announced on Saturday.
The party is losing "an important personality," said parliamentary group chairman Dietmar Bartsch and former parliamentary group leader Gregor Gysi.
In the 1970s, Hans Modrow became the 1st secretary of the district leadership of the SED in Dresden.
As Prime Minister, he accompanied the end of the GDR.
Only four days after the fall of the Berlin Wall, on November 13, 1989, he became chairman of the Council of Ministers of the GDR for about 150 days.
In the elections to the People's Chamber on 18 March 1990, the SED/PDS lost power and Modrow lost his office a month later.
He was succeeded by the CDU politician Lothar de Maizière as the last prime minister of the GDR until reunification.
The chairman of the parliamentary group of the Left Party, Dietmar Bartsch, described Modrow in a message on the short message service Twitter as a "deeply sincere and combative socialist".
Bartsch added:
"Until old age, he was an important advisor in our party, whose wisdom will be lacking.
"The entire peaceful course of the establishment of German unity was precisely a special merit of his.
This will remain his political legacy," Bartsch and Gysi wrote in their obituary.
It goes on to say:

"His later work in the People's Chamber, in the Bundestag, in the European Parliament and as honorary chairman of the PDS always consisted of representing that part of the former GDR population that was not wanted and whose interests were regularly violated.
After reunification, Modrow sat for the PDS in the German Bundestag from 1990 to 1994 and represented it in the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
According to a report by the German Press Agency (dpa), Modrow was "quite critical" of the new state.

German reunification had been accomplished too quickly, the GDR had gone down too unconditionally, and it had been condemned too one-sidedly as an "unjust state," Modrow had criticized in many interviews, according to dpa.

1. General
The one-man entertainment device BATTLEZONE is equipped with a Vector or X/Y monitor.
This game illustrates the battle from the perspective of a tanker.
The battles are fought in a wide valley, which is completely enclosed by mountains and volcanoes.
In the valley there are rock pyramids and rock blocks, which offer the player temporary protection, as they cannot be destroyed by enemy shots.
The enemy is represented by slow-moving tracked vehicles and fast super tanks, as well as nimble missiles, which become increasingly difficult to hit as the game progresses.
In addition, UFOs appear at periodic intervals.
These cannot attack the player tank.
Conversely, however, the player can achieve a high score by hitting a UFO.
The BATTLEZONE device has five (5) different modes of operation.
These are the attraction sequence, the game initiation sequence, the game abl on, the initial input for maximum results and the self-test procedure.
The latter mode of operation is a special procedure for checking the controls and the computer function.
4. Gameplay
The game is triggered when the START pressure switch is pressed.
The LED switch remains illuminated and the game sounds become audible.
If the last player tank is eliminated by the enemy attacker, a game is over.
The game starts with slow-moving tanks that become visible on the screen.
The player can determine the position of the respective enemy tanks or missiles by paying attention to the text displayed in the upper left hint display angle of his cockpit.
A hint can be, for example:
OPPONENTS FROM THE RIGHT.
In addition, on the long-range radar screen, accompanied by a sonar BLIP tone, a dot becomes visible that represents the enemy position.
The upper, cone-shaped surface on the radar screen represents the player's field of view on the screen below.
If the opponent is in this area, he is well targeted on the screen.
Furthermore, ENEMIES IN THE FIRING RANGE is displayed in the upper left hint display at the same time.
Occasionally, UFOs become visible on the screen, flying over the battlefield.
These are safe missiles that observe the battle and cannot eliminate either the enemy or the player's tank.
The flight position of the UFO's cannot be detected by the radar.
The UFO's are intended to round off the battle and distract the player, as they usually appear at the same time as enemy tanks or missiles.
UFO's can be eliminated from both the player tank and the enemy tank.
A kill by the player earns him 5,000 points.
If an enemy is hit, the following points are achieved: 1,000 points for a slow-moving tank, 2,000 points for a rocket and 3,000 points for a super tank.
A Super Tank drives and spins twice as fast as the Player Tank or an enemy slow-moving tank.
Several possibilities give the stander the opportunity to use 2, 3, 4 or even 5 tanks for a game sequence.
Furthermore, after reaching predetermined scores, a bonus tank can be released and the appearance of the rocket can be varied for a more difficult game design.
Details and the exact switching positions of the game sequence selector switch for this setting option can be found in the figure.
5. Initial input for maximum results
If a player exceeds the minimum number of points in the table of maximum results, HE or SHE may enter three (3) personal initials in the table at the end of the game.
The instructions for this are self-explanatory and can be displayed in four languages.

It should be noted that when a self-test is triggered, the RESET button is pressed on the Battlezone Analog Vector Generator PCB or an interruption of the mains voltage, the table with the highest results is deleted.
When RESET is performed, the top ten (10) scores are obtained with their initials and re-enrolled on the screen to challenge more players.
Any score above 100,000 is additionally marked with a tank icon, followed by the player's initials.
If a player does not enter their initials within 60 seconds, the computer will automatically write in dashes.
After that, the device switches back to the attraction gameplay.
ASSEMBLY ARRANGEMENT
1. New parts
The BATTLEZONE device has five (5) new components.
If you already have experience with ATARI video equipment, you should take note of these important differences.
The new parts are: A.
The control lever.
This is a redesign of the ATARI shifter.
It has been reinforced by several additional ribs in the inner and outer parts of the housing, which made this unit more stable and ensures proper functioning of the switch contacts.
Another modification is the rubber centering bellows, which, like a centering spring, repeatedly brings the control lever to the center position.
The micro shells are now fastened with self-locking nuts for easier replacement.
B. Two PC boards.
ATARI's X/Y game circuit has been extended to two (2) interconnected boards.
These are the Analog Vector generator board and the auxiliary board.
With the help of this switching technology, more lines are generated on the screen at a higher speed, resulting in a smooth and steady image.
C. The power supply.
Battlezone is equipped with a newly designed power supply.
It has a larger, more powerful transformer to cover the increased power supply given by the expansion of the circuit.
D.
The device housing.
Due to the new design, it was now possible to install a new cash register with a larger coin capacity.
Furthermore, there is a console in the device, which is intended as a pedestal for smaller players to make gaming easier.
At the same time, this console ensures maximum device stability at the installation site.
These new components, as well as all other main assemblies of this device, are shown in Figure 1.
If one of these new parts is mentioned in the manual, you will find this sign.
2. Equipment
Inspection
After removing the packaging, this new entertainment device is ready to play.
Nevertheless, you should do some checking to round out the quality control.
In order to be sure that the device has been delivered to you in a proper condition, the following checks should be carried out:
NOTE:
Do not yet connect the device to the 220 V mains.
A. Inspect the outside of the housing for damage.
B. Open the maintenance hatch of the device and check the components inside the device as follows:
Check all wiring harness connectors for correct and firm connection.
Connect any open or loose plugs to each other.
NOTE:
Never forcibly make plug connections.
The plugs are provided with a forced guide so that a correct connection is made.
A connector twisted by 180 degrees will destroy the PCB.
Check the plug connections to the gaming PC board for proper and tight fit.
(3) Pay attention to the production number of the device on the type plate on the back of the device.
Check that the stamped production numbers match those of the Battlezone Analog Vector Generator PC board, auxiliary PC board, knob/Audio II PC board, and TV monitor.
An illustration of the location of the production number can be found on the back cover of this manual.
This number should always be provided when calling your dealer for more service information.
Check all other main components such as the power supply, the control console and the TV monitor for proper assembly.
Finally, the device must be supplied with mains voltage and switched on.
By looking through the player's viewing glass, it is necessary to check whether the radar screen is also located in the bright, orange circled opening of the fairing.
If the opening is not precisely centered, the cladding, which is attached to the housing with an adhesive tape, must be loosened and realigned.
Before the device is connected to the mains supply, it must be ensured that the voltage selector plug on the power supply 1 (see Fig. 3) corresponds to the local mains voltage.

ARE YOU HAVING PROBLEMS WITH YOUR SOFTWARE?
Below are a number of tips that can help you solve most problems related to current DirectX games.
Verify the system configuration
Please take the time to check if your system meets the requirements listed on the package.
You can use the DirectX Diagnostic Tool to get an overview of your system if you're not sure if your PC meets the requirements.
To enter the DirectX diagnostic program, please follow these steps:
Click on the "Start" button and select the "Run" option.
In the text box, type "dxdiag".
Now you will see the user interface of the DirectX Diagnostic Tool.
Here you have access to all relevant system details, including information about the graphics and sound card.
Among other things, you can check if the graphics and sound are working properly by clicking the appropriate buttons to test DirectDraw, Direct3D, and DirectSound.
Note: If you do not have advanced computer skills, we would advise you not to change any of the options in the DirectX Diagnostic Tool.
Before starting the game
It may happen that other programs take up the system resources that the game needs to run properly.
Not all of these programs are obvious to be active, and many start automatically when the system boots up.
Such programs that are constantly active on your system are also called "background applications".
In some cases, they can be the cause of your program hanging or crashing.
That is why we recommend that you terminate such background applications before starting the game.
If you have antivirus or crash guard programs running on your system, you should close or disable them before starting the game.
To do this, find the program's icon on the Windows taskbar.
Right-click the icon and select the appropriate option ("Disable", "Close", or similar).
Once you have disabled the antivirus and Crash Guard programs, you should also quit general background applications as they sometimes cause problems when you install or run a PC game.
You can read more about this in the section "How to quit all unnecessary background applications".
Clean up the system
Before you install any software, it's important to make sure that your hard drive is working optimally.
You should therefore make it a habit to "clean up" your PC at regular intervals.
The tools you need to do this come with Windows: use ScanDisk, Disk Defragmenter, and Disk Cleanup to keep everything running smoothly.
Then there is a good chance that current games will run largely smoothly on your PC.
A "clean" system also has the advantage that it works much more efficiently, and thus other applications that you use run faster and more stable.
Consult the Windows Help files to learn about the ScanDisk or Error Checking, Defragmentation, and Disk Cleanup tools.
Using Windows
Help
1. Click on the "Start" button and select the "Help" option (or "Help and Support") to access Windows Help.
2. Now, click in the Search box and enter the appropriate keyword, such as "ScanDisk" (Win 98/ME), "Error Checking" (Win 2000/XP), "Disk Defragmenter" and "Disk Cleanup".
You will then receive a guide explaining how to use these tools.
The game crashes or hangs?
For games that use the latest version of DirectX, make sure you have the latest drivers for your graphics card.
This is often a way to prevent a game from crashing or hanging.
First of all, you should try to download the latest drivers from the website of the manufacturer of the graphics card.
Below you will find the latest graphics card manufacturers:
How to quit all unnecessary background application
Important note:
After the game ends, you should reactivate the background applications by restarting your PC.
This will automatically wake up any background applications that you have quit.
Windows 98/ME
1. Hold down the CTRL and ALT keys on your keyboard, then press DELETE.
Now, the "Close Application" window will appear, which will list all the background applications that are currently running on your system.
2. To quit a background application, click on the entry in the task list and then click on the "End Task" button.
Note: Do not quit the Explorer and Systray background applications under any circumstances, as they are required to run Windows.
You can safely quit all other background applications.
3. The window will now close and the task is finished.
Repeat the above steps to quit all other background applications (except "Explorer" and "Systray").
Windows 2000/XP Professional
1. Hold down the CTRL and ALT keys on your keyboard, then press DELETE.
Now the Windows Security window will appear.
2. Click "Task Manager" to open Windows Task Manager.
To quit a background application, go to the Applications tab, click on the corresponding entry in the task list, and then click on the "End Task" button.
Note: Depending on your system settings, pressing CTRL, ALT, and DEL may not display the Windows Security window, but the Windows Task Manager will appear immediately.
Windows XP
Home
1. Hold down the CTRL and ALT keys on your keyboard, then press DELETE.
Now, the Windows Task Manager will appear.
2. To quit a background application, go to the "Applications" tab, click on the corresponding entry in the task list, and then click on the "End Task" button.
Before you call the hotline
If you want to call, you should sit down at your PC and have the following information ready (see the "Checking System Configuration" section).
Please also prepare note material.
PC make and model
Processor type
Operating system including version number (e. g.
Windows® 98; Windows® Me)
RAM (memory) information about video and sound card and drivers
INTRODUCTORY WORDS TO FAHRENHEIT

The desire to create video games was sparked in me by the advent of real-time 3D technology, which suddenly opened up a whole new possibilities and seemed to me to be a new means of expression that could push the world to its limits.
For me, it was an opportunity to open up new horizons.

I felt like a cinematographic pioneer at the beginning of the 20th century: on the one hand, I was struggling with the still immature technology, but on the other hand, I was aware that there was still everything to be discovered especially a new language that had to be both narrative and visual.
To be completely honest, the next ten years could not satisfy my hunger.

I had the dull feeling that video games were exploiting only a tiny part of their amazing creative possibilities, because they were too focused on "action" and forgot about a fundamental element of the human experience: sensations.
Meanwhile, the technology continued to make rapid progress.
Fahrenheit is my contribution to making video games a true means of expression that transmits feelings.
Although this could of course have been done in a completely different form, Fahrenheit's greatest merit is the fact that real questions are raised and concrete answers are offered here.

Fahrenheit is proof that you can create an interactive gaming experience that isn't just about fighting hideous monsters in dark corridors and shooting at boxes to get ammunition, but has far more challenging and in-depth content.
It's proof that you can both tell a story and offer game content without sacrificing the narrative or interactive elements.
I hope that both die-hard gamers and casual gamers will enjoy this new gaming experience.
If you're more skeptical about video games, I hope that Fahrenheit will help change your mindset.
May other developers also feel the desire to embark on this new creative path and enrich it with their own inspirations, talent and ambition.
Interactivity is still in its infancy and offers the chance to discover everything first.

Over the past two years, Fahrenheit has filled a large part of our lives and has been an unforgettable interpersonal and intellectual adventure for the entire Quantic Dream team, forcing us to question many of the principles previously considered incontrovertible.
I'd be lucky if Fahrenheit much like books, movies, and songs that have left a lasting impression on you doesn't leave you completely unscathed either.
David Cage
THE README FILE
There is a ReadMe file on the Fahrenheit DVD-ROM where you can view the license agreement and updated information about the game.
We recommend that you take a look at this file so that you can take note of the changes that have been made after this manual has been printed.
To view the file, double-click it in the Fahrenheit directory on your hard disk (usually C:\Program Files\Atari\Fahrenheit).
You can also access the ReadMe file by first clicking on the Start button on the Windows® taskbar and then selecting "Programs", "Atari", "Fahrenheit" and finally the ReadMe file.
SETUP AND INSTALLATION
1. Start Windows® 2000/XP.
2. Insert the Fahrenheit DVD-ROM into the DVD-ROM drive.
3. If the "AutoPlay" option is enabled, the title screen should appear.
If AutoPlay isn't turned on, or if the installation doesn't start automatically, click the Start button on the Windows® taskbar, and then click Run.
Type D:\Setup, and then click OK.
Note: If your DVD-ROM drive is assigned a letter other than "D", use it appropriately.
4. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation of the Fahrenheit DVD-ROM.
5. Once the installation is complete, click on the Start button on the Windows® taskbar and select Programs/Atari/Fahrenheit/Fahrenheit to start the game.
Note: The Fahrenheit DVD-ROM must be in the DVD-ROM drive before you can play.

Please note when setting up
Damage
As far as external transport damage is recognizable, it must be complained about immediately, recorded on a transport note and confirmed by the supplier (freight forwarder, federal railroad, etc. ).
The manufacturer is not liable for transport damage!
Line voltage
The device is set for the mains voltage indicated on the rating plate.
For other mains voltages, the device transformer and the monitor transformer must be switched.
According to VDE regulations, the device is equipped with a protective conductor connection and is only intended for dry rooms.
Flawless operation of the coin system requires horizontal and perpendicular installation of the device.
SERVICE TIPS
IMPORTANT!
If an incomprehensible display appears on the monitor at any time, please switch the machine off briefly (unplug it) and turn it on again.
If the device does not work properly afterwards, a repair is necessary.
Unplug the power cord before repairing!
During monitoring and testing:
Do not touch live parts!
Even when the device is switched off, the monitor can still carry dangerous voltage.
ATTENTION, HIGH VOLTAGE!
There are about 20000 volts at the anode connection of the picture tube.
Replace fuses only with those with the same values!
A blown fuse signals overload of a component.
If the fuse is replaced with a higher-quality one, serious damage can be caused.
Replace components only with original spare parts.
Never remove printed circuits/connections when the power is on.
SERVICE MANUAL QIX
Gameplay
By pressing the corresponding start button, the game is started for one or (with minimum credit 2) for 2 players.
It is necessary to try to get a lot of area without crossing the path of the rotating QIX and without hitting the wandering SPAXX.
The course of the game is set in such a way that a minimum prescribed area must be occupied before you can tackle the next area (round).

SERVICE PROGRAM
General.
For programming and testing, the 4 switches located in the device the self-test button and the LED's on the video PC board are used.
Programming display.

Deployment programming.

Furthermore, it can be used to set a "maximum number of credits" that may be before the start of the game.
The lettering to be changed is set by pressing the "Sub-Test" switch (appears green), the desired value for this line is programmed with the "Up" or "Down" switch.
By pressing the "Sub-Test" switch several times, the factory or default setting can be reached, when the bottom line (RESET line) lights up green, press "Up" switch".
The values are reset, the pointer (so the lines appearing green) jumps to the first line, further programming can be done.
"Test" always triggers the next program display.
"Back" [Reserve High Score value x 10 000) is used to transfer the high score point to the next program display until "High hit rate so far".

The "maximum number of credits" determines a coin acceptance limit for the device.
If the limit is exceeded, if there is a coin lock the coin acceptance is blocked.
This allows a limited number of games to be set for one player.
This value is from 1 99.
It should not be placed so close to 99, so that by inserting a coin, the credits cannot become zero if more than 99 is added.
A free spins mode can be chosen by setting "Maximum Credits" to O.

By pressing the "Up" switch, the values are set to 0.

Slot programming/normal money setting.
With the help of this display, a standard coin setting can be selected by the display or another setting can be programmed
If a default setting is provided, pressing the "Up" and "Down" buttons selects the programming, while the top digit lights up green on the screen.
The size values change with the change of the digit.
When the correct setting is reached by pressing the "Test" switch, the setting is applied.
If a setting is desired that does not correspond to the standard setting, the values can be set by pressing the "Sub-Test" switch.
After pressing once, the upper setting number is set to 0, which means that your own setting is possible.
Since the lower values are unchanged, the programmer can reduce his adjustment efforts by choosing a setting that is close to his desired values and only changing the values that are not suitable.
Once the setting has been made, any new size to be set can be selected by pressing the "Sub-Test" switch.
In case of unintentional pressing, the default setting appears.
The "Up" and "Down" switches can be used to increase or decrease the values.
By pressing the "Test" button, the process is finished.
The coin multiplier ("coin unit") says how many coin units are given for each coin inserted through an assigned slot.
Coin Units
"Credit" shows the number of units required before a loan is issued.
"Bonus"
Coin Units shows the required units before a bonus credit is issued.
"Min. Coin" is a value that accumulates credits until a set minimum amount of coins is reached.
By default, this value "0" is not used.
CMOS MEMORY FAILURE
If "Memory Failure Service Required" appears on the display, the CMOS RAM, in which all programming is stored, has failed.
All values stored in the RAM are reset to factory default.
This condition probably indicates failure or failure of the battery.
TROUBLESHOOTING & SETTINGS
Start of the test method.
Press the "Sub-Test" switch or the "Self-Test" button (SW 1 near the LED indicator).
All LEDs should light up and the hardware test can begin.
The tests and settings can be entered for the respective program display, by pressing the "Test" button the next program is displayed.
If an endurance test of the video board is desired, the self-test button must be pressed twice so that the video test begins in the auto-test mode.
With this program, the device will run the hardware test continuously until it is shut down.
When the "Open Coin Door to Test" indicator appears, the program plug J 19, 1 2 must be plugged in.
When the J 19 connector is disconnected, the memory is protected and the CMOS RAM test video cannot be performed.
Hardware tests:
These tests are performed as follows: O = off / I = on / X = test results
The ROM checksum calculates the checksum of each video ROM and compares it to the checksum stored for that ROM.
If there is a difference, the device stops and the value of the ROM with the wrong checksum appears on the LEDs.
If the checksum ROM is error-proof, U 10 is displayed first.
If this test fails, the next ROM shown on the LED display must be replaced.
The E-PROM memory in a given game can be introduced as a banks (series) of either 2716 or 2732 E-PROM's.
The E-PROM type for each series is selected by the decoding connector (26-00002-016 for 2716 or 26-00002-032 for 2732).
Communications RAM from Video Board

The Communications RAM test determines the functional reliability of the memory, which is shared between two processors, by storing predetermined series of numbers in RAM and then checking whether the memory was correct.
LED value: 00 0010
If the device stops with the above display, an error has been detected.
If the communications RAMs fail during the video board test, the error may have been caused by defective wiring (RAM) or errors in the data board.
To locate the error, remove the data board from P 6 and repeat the test.
A failure means: fault in the U 3, U 4 or associated circuits.
Video Board CMOS RAM
After values are inscribed to another part of the memory, the CMOS RAM is checked in the same way as the Communications RAM.
If the test is passed, all memory locations are set to their former value.
LED value: 00 0011
If the device with the above display stops, there is an error.
In this case, check U 85 and U 86 and the connected circuits or decoding.
Check video board color RAM by storing predetermined sequences of numbers in the color RAM.
These numbers are checked for correctness when they are read back.
LED value: 00 0100
If this value is displayed, there is an error.
Check U 56, U 57, associated multiplexers and decoders.
Video board (display RAM).
The display RAM is checked by inscribing a pattern on each page.
The results of these enrollments are compared with the original pattern.
Any discrepancy will cause the program to stop and the LEDs will indicate the faulty RAM.
If a display RAM fails, determine the problem and replace the RAM.
If this fault diagnosis does not show a RAM failure (00 0101 on LEDs), it is indicated that the next check is being started (data hardware).
The connection to the data processor must exist and it must be functional.

Since there are hardly any reviews to read here, I was very skeptical at first.

About the mattress:

When inflated, a lying test was carried out directly.
It's easy to lie on and fits in perfectly with the festival.

The mattress fits wonderfully into my car.
Previously, we took out the seats in the back.
Thus, it fits perfectly.
The air pump:
The air pump has various adapters.
The mattress requires two different adapters, which can also be found on the pump.
The pump is plugged into the car's cigarette lighter.
However, the connector was defective (something at the solder joint).
Since my boyfriend is a skilled craftsman, he was able to repair it and reassembled, the good part worked excellently and pumped up the mattress in no time.
Overall, I am very enthusiastic about the mattress.
I'm looking forward to the endurance test at the festival.
I hope that it does not lose air and also lasts a long time.
Likewise, that he mold does not reappear.
After the test, I can definitely recommend them.
